llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach (value=1) — largest contributor: SHAP +2.926 (increase). The model’s score rose primarily because the payment was made via ACH.
- payment_currency_saudi_riyal (value=1) — SHAP +0.616 (increase). The payment currency being Saudi riyal contributed to increasing the flag score.
- payment_currency_us_dollar (value=0) — SHAP +0.335 (increase). The payment not being in US dollars increases the score (the model attributes higher score when payment_currency_us_dollar = 0).
- receiving_currency_saudi_riyal (value=1) — SHAP +0.242 (increase). The receiving currency being Saudi riyal further increased the score.
- from_bank (value=148016) — SHAP -0.432 (decrease). The sending bank ID reduced the model score (partially offsetting the increases above).

Conclusion:
The transaction was flagged mainly because it is an ACH payment (payment_format_ach=1) denominated in Saudi riyal (payment_currency_saudi_riyal=1 and receiving_currency_saudi_riyal=1), with the absence of USD (payment_currency_us_dollar=0) also increasing the score. This upward pressure was partially offset by a negative contribution from the sending bank (from_bank = 148016). If the positive contributions from the ACH and Saudi riyal features outweigh the sending-bank decrease (as indicated by the SHAP magnitudes), the net model score led to the alert.
